downtime-dnd5e.InvalidNumberWarning: Invalid input. Please enter a number.
downtime-dnd5e.ItemNotFoundWarning: Could not find tracked item called
downtime-dnd5e.ProgressValueIsNanWarning: Progress value is not a number
downtime-dnd5e.ToolNotFoundWarning: Selected tool not found. Please edit the item and select a new one.
downtime-dnd5e.SettingGmOnlyModeHint: Enabling this will put the module into GM Only mode. When this is on, the tab does not display on sheets for non-GM users, completion messages are automatically whispered to GM rather than displayed publicly, and roll dialogs will automatically have the Private GM Roll mode selected.
downtime-dnd5e.SettingGmOnlyEditModeHint: Enabling this will put the module into GM Only Edit mode. When this is on, only a GM can add/edit category or add/edit any training. Basically the player can only roll the dice.
downtime-dnd5e.SettingShowDowntimeTabPcH: Toggling this on will display the tracking tab on all PC sheets. You will need to close and reopen sheets for this to take effect.
downtime-dnd5e.SettingShowDowntimeTabNpc: Toggling this on will display the tracking tab on all NPC sheets. You will need to close and reopen sheets for this to take effect.
downtime-dnd5e.SettingDowntimeTabNameHin: Sets the title of the training tab to whatever you enter here. Default is 'Downtime,' but you may wish to call it something else depending on how you use the module.
downtime-dnd5e.SettingExtraSheetWidthHin: (Client) Entering a value here will change the default character sheet width by the specified number of pixels. You might need to adjust this to be bigger or smaller to ensure that the sheet's tabs stay on one line. The default is 50, and works if you're using the core dnd5e sheet and the default tab name.
downtime-dnd5e.SettingDefaultCompletionT: Sets the default target number required to reach 100% completion for tracked items using check-based progression. A good rule of thumb is that the average person will be able to contribute about 10 points to their progress total per check. The default is 300 (or 30 days for the average person who trains once a day).
downtime-dnd5e.SettingAnnounceCompletion: Choose which actor types you would like to have trigger chat messages upon tracked item completion.
downtime-dnd5e.SettingShowImportButtonHi: Enable this to display the import button on the tracking tab. This is meant to be a troubleshooting / data restoration tool, and there are no checks in place to prevent the importing of unexpected data. Importing unexpected data in this way can break the module for the actor. You use this feature AT YOUR OWN RISK. The developer is happy to help you un-break things if something happens, but she makes no guarantees.
downtime-dnd5e.SettingTabNameHint: Sets the title of the tab to whatever you enter here. Default is 'Tracking,' but you may wish to call it something else depending on how you use the module.
downtime-dnd5e.SettingAnnounceActivityCo: These actor types will cause a chat message to display any time they complete a tracked item.
downtime-dnd5e.SettingReset.name: Reset settings to default
downtime-dnd5e.SettingReset.hint: This will reset all of the settings of back to the active game system's default.
downtime-dnd5e.SettingReset.dialogs.cont: Are you sure you want to reset all of the module settings to the current system's defaults? THIS CANNOT BE UNDONE!
downtime-dnd5e.SettingDebug.title: Enable debugging
downtime-dnd5e.SettingDebug.label: Prints debug messages to the console
downtime-dnd5e.InputErrorName: Please enter a valid item name.
downtime-dnd5e.InputErrorMacroName: Please enter a valid macro name/id/uuid.
downtime-dnd5e.InputErrorFixedIncrease: Please enter a valid increase number.
downtime-dnd5e.InputErrorCompletionAt: Please enter a valid completion target.
downtime-dnd5e.InputErrorProgress: Please enter a valid progress number.
downtime-dnd5e.CompletionTargetInputHelp: The cumulative total of all checks required for the item to be marked as complete. Must be a number above zero.
downtime-dnd5e.SuccessesRequiredInputHel: The number of successful checks that must be made to complete. Must be a number above zero.
downtime-dnd5e.FixedIncreaseInputHelpTex: The amount that this item's progress increased by every time the item is rolled. Must be a number above zero.
downtime-dnd5e.MacroNameInputHelpText: The name/id/uuid of the macro to run when this item is rolled. Must be exact.
downtime-dnd5e.ToolInputHelpText: This list is populated based on the tools in this actor's inventory. If there's nothing in it, add a tool and try again.
downtime-dnd5e.ProgressInputHelpText: The item's current progress value. Must be a number between zero and the item's Completion Target (if no DC is set) or Successes Required (if DC is set).
downtime-dnd5e.ChangeLogDeleteNote: Note: Dismissing changes does NOT revert them. If you'd like to revert changes you see here, you must do so manually, but this log can serve as a guide to help you figure out what changes to make if required.
downtime-dnd5e.ChangeLogInstructionsGm: This log shows a list of all changes made to the progress of each of this character's tracked items. You may remove items from this list after you've reviewed them by checking the box in the Dismiss column and hitting the button at the bottom of the window. Once you do this, neither you nor the player will be able to see them anymore.
downtime-dnd5e.ChangeLogInstructionsPlay: This log shows a list of changes made to the progress of each of your tracked items that have not yet been reviewed by your GM. Once they are reviewed, they will no longer be visible here.
downtime-dnd5e.CategoryCreationInstructi: You can use categories to organize items on this tab.
downtime-dnd5e.Name: Name
downtime-dnd5e.DeleteCategoryConfirmatio: Are you sure you want to delete this category? All items in the category will be moved to the Uncategorized section.
downtime-dnd5e.DeleteItemConfirmation: Are you sure you want to delete this item?
downtime-dnd5e.ProgressionStyleFixedHelp: Each time you roll, the item's progress amount is increased by a set value.
downtime-dnd5e.ProgressionStyleAbilityCh: Each time you roll, you will be prompted to make the specified ability check. If no DC is set, the item's progress will be increased by a number equal to the result of the check. If a DC is set, a successful check will increase progress by 1.
downtime-dnd5e.ProgressionStyleSkillChec: Each time you roll, you will be prompted to make the specified skill check. If no DC is set, the item's progress will be increased by a number equal to the result of the check. If a DC is set, a successful check will increase progress by 1.
downtime-dnd5e.ProgressionStyleToolCheck: Each time you roll, you will be prompted to make the specified tool check. If no DC is set, the item's progress will be increased by a number equal to the result of the check. If a DC is set, a successful check will increase progress by 1.
downtime-dnd5e.ProgressionStyleMacroHelp: Each time you roll, the referenced macro will run. In order for the item's progress to be increased, the macro will have to make a call to this module's API. For sample macros and API documentation, visit the module's github repository.
downtime-dnd5e.MigrationPromptText1: The latest update of this module made a change to how its data is structured. Any actors that are tracking items using the old data will need to be migrated to this new structure before those items can be used again.
downtime-dnd5e.MigrationPromptText2: Migrations can cause data to be lost or corrupted. We back up this module's data when we do the migration, but we highly recommend that you back up all your data, just to be safe.
downtime-dnd5e.MigrationPromptText3: You own {num} actor(s) that need updates. Would you like to run the migration now?
downtime-dnd5e.ExportTrackedItemsTooltip: Export tracked items to a file
downtime-dnd5e.ImportTrackedItemsTooltip: Import tracked items from a file
downtime-dnd5e.ExportNoTrackedItems: No items or categories to export. Cancelling export.
downtime-dnd5e.ImportNoTrackedItems: No items or categories to import. Cancelling import.
downtime-dnd5e.ImportTypeSelectionTextOv: Permanently deletes all current tracked items and replaces them with the ones you're importing.
downtime-dnd5e.ImportTypeSelectionTextCo: Combines the current tracked items with the ones you're trying to import and keeps them both.
downtime-dnd5e.ImportOldWarningText: The data you imported is from an older version of the module that didn't support the export of category data along with items. We imported it for you anyway, but all items have been placed into the Uncategorized category.
downtime-dnd5e.NoIdWarning: Item ID not found. This is probably because this item was created by an earlier version of this module, and can usually be solved by refreshing the page and choosing to perform the migration when prompted. If no migration prompt is presented, The developer can help you out! Export this actor's tracked items and send them to the developer via a bug report on GitHub or Discord.
